body.p: First of all you have to choose how all the JMX infrastructure is provided. Various JMX implementations are freely available.
HiveMind uses MX4J for development and testing, but it can run with any other JMX 1.2 implementation. HiveMind has additionally been tested with J2SE 1.5 and the Sun Reference Implementation of JMX.

section.title: MX4J
section.p: Get MX4J here in version 2.x or grab the libraries from the ext-package/lib folder after an ant build of HiveMind
Add mx4j.jar, mx4j-tools.jar to the classpath. Add mx4j-remote.jar only if you use JSR 160 connectors.

section.title: J2SE 1.5
section.p: If your application runs with Sun J2SE 1.5 no additional libraries are needed This can change later if you decide to use HTTP to manage your application.

section.title: Sun Reference Implementation
section.p: The Sun RI can be downloaded here in version 1.2.1
Add jmxri.jar and jmxtools.jar to the classpath.
